entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French remaindre, from Latin remanēre, from re- + manēre to remain mansion

def.dt: :to be a part not destroyed, taken, or used up only a few ruins remain
:to be something yet to be shown, done, or treated it remains to be seen
:to stay in the same place or with the same person or group
:to continue unchanged the fact remains that we can't go
:a remaining part or trace usually used in plural
